title: U.S. faces stiff competition from China in satellite remote sensing
summary: A report by national security think tanks highlights the competitive landscape of the global commercial remote sensing industry, comparing U.S. and Chinese capabilities. The U.S. leads in SAR imaging, while China excels in electro-optical and multispectral systems. Finnish company ICEYE is mentioned as a top performer in SAR but is not involved in any concrete deal.
why_it_matters: The report underscores the intensifying competition between the U.S. and China in commercial remote sensing, with implications for national security and industry leadership. It also notes the need for U.S. government support to maintain competitiveness.
